TypeSignature.Value: Public NotInheritable Class VelocityTracker Inherits Object
public ref class VelocityTracker sealed : Java::Lang::Object
.class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit VelocityTracker extends Java.Lang.Object

Docs.summary: Helper for tracking the velocity of motion events, for implementing flinging and other such gestures.

remarks.para:
Helper for tracking the velocity of motion events, for implementing flinging and other such gestures.
Use #obtain to retrieve a new instance of the class when you are going to begin tracking. Put the motion events you receive into it with #addMovement(MotionEvent). When you want to determine the velocity, call #computeCurrentVelocity(int) and then call the velocity-getter methods like #getXVelocity(int), #getYVelocity(int), or #getAxisVelocity(int, int) to retrieve velocity for different axes and/or pointer IDs.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void AddMovement(class Android.Views.MotionEvent e) cil managed

Docs.param: The MotionEvent you received and would like to track.
The MotionEvent you received and would like to track.
Docs.summary: Add a user's movement to the tracker.

remarks.para: Add a user's movement to the tracker. You should call this for the initial MotionEvent#ACTION_DOWN, the following MotionEvent#ACTION_MOVE events that you receive, and the final MotionEvent#ACTION_UP. You can, however, call this for whichever events you desire.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Clear() cil managed

Docs.summary: Reset the velocity tracker back to its initial state.

remarks.para: Reset the velocity tracker back to its initial state.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void ComputeCurrentVelocity(int32 units) cil managed

Docs.summary: Equivalent to invoking #computeCurrentVelocity(int, float) with a maximum velocity of Float.

remarks.para: Equivalent to invoking #computeCurrentVelocity(int, float) with a maximum velocity of Float.MAX_VALUE.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Sub ComputeCurrentVelocity (units As Integer, maxVelocity As Single)
public: void ComputeCurrentVelocity(int units, float maxVelocity);
public void ComputeCurrentVelocity (int units, float maxVelocity);
.method public hidebysig instance void ComputeCurrentVelocity(int32 units, float32 maxVelocity) cil managed

Docs.param: The units you would like the velocity in. A value of 1 provides units per millisecond, 1000 provides units per second, etc. Note that the units referred to here are the same units with which motion is reported. For axes X and Y, the units are pixels.
The maximum velocity that can be computed by this method. This value must be declared in the same unit as the units parameter. This value must be positive.
Docs.summary: Compute the current velocity based on the points that have been collected.

remarks.para: Compute the current velocity based on the points that have been collected. Only call this when you actually want to retrieve velocity information, as it is relatively expensive. You can then retrieve the velocity with #getXVelocity() and #getYVelocity().
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Function GetAxisVelocity (axis As Axis) As Single
.method public hidebysig instance float32 GetAxisVelocity(valuetype Android.Views.Axis axis) cil managed

Docs.summary: Equivalent to calling #getAxisVelocity(int, int) for axis and the active pointer.
Docs.returns: The previously computed velocity for axis for the active pointer if axis is supported for velocity tracking, or 0 if velocity tracking is not supported for the axis.

remarks.para: Equivalent to calling #getAxisVelocity(int, int) for axis and the active pointer.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Function GetAxisVelocity (axis As Axis, id As Integer) As Single
public: float GetAxisVelocity(Android::Views::Axis axis, int id);
public float GetAxisVelocity (Android.Views.Axis axis, int id);
.method public hidebysig instance float32 GetAxisVelocity(valuetype Android.Views.Axis axis, int32 id) cil managed

Docs.summary: Retrieve the last computed velocity for a given motion axis.
Docs.returns: The previously computed velocity for axis for pointer ID of id if axis is supported for velocity tracking, or 0 if velocity tracking is not supported for the axis.

remarks.para: Retrieve the last computed velocity for a given motion axis. You must first call #computeCurrentVelocity(int) or #computeCurrentVelocity(int, float) before calling this function.

In addition to MotionEvent#AXIS_X and MotionEvent#AXIS_Y which have been supported since the introduction of this class, the following axes can be candidates for this method:
  • MotionEvent#AXIS_SCROLL: supported starting android.os.Build.VERSION_CODES#UPSIDE_DOWN_CAKE
Before accessing velocities of an axis using this method, check that your VelocityTracker instance supports the axis by using #isAxisSupported(int).
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Function IsAxisSupported (axis As Axis) As Boolean
.method public hidebysig instance bool IsAxisSupported(valuetype Android.Views.Axis axis) cil managed

Docs.param: The axis to check for velocity support.
Docs.summary: Checks whether a given velocity-trackable MotionEvent axis is supported for velocity tracking by this VelocityTracker instance (refer to #getAxisVelocity(int, int) for a list of potentially velocity-trackable axes).
Docs.returns: true if axis is supported for velocity tracking, or false otherwise.

remarks.para: Checks whether a given velocity-trackable MotionEvent axis is supported for velocity tracking by this VelocityTracker instance (refer to #getAxisVelocity(int, int) for a list of potentially velocity-trackable axes).
Note that the value returned from this method will stay the same for a given instance, so a single check for axis support is enough per a VelocityTracker instance.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared Function Obtain () As VelocityTracker
.method public static hidebysig class Android.Views.VelocityTracker Obtain() cil managed

Docs.summary: Retrieve a new VelocityTracker object to watch the velocity of a motion.

remarks.para: Retrieve a new VelocityTracker object to watch the velocity of a motion. Be sure to call #recycle when done. You should generally only maintain an active object while tracking a movement, so that the VelocityTracker can be re-used elsewhere.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Recycle() cil managed

Docs.summary: Return a VelocityTracker object back to be re-used by others.

remarks.para: Return a VelocityTracker object back to be re-used by others. You must not touch the object after calling this function.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.
